Coronation Street viewers have been shocked by a recent storyline involving underage Bethany Platt being groomed by Nathan Curtis. 
But the ITV soap actress Lucy Fallon has confessed she hasn’t watched any of it. 
Speaking to Helen Skelton on ITV’s Lorraine, Lucy revealed she feels “too uncomfortable” to watch Bethany’s situation. 
She said: “I haven’t watched it, because it makes me feel uncomfortable. Read More Bethany Platt is being groomed by Nathan Curtis on Corrie (Photo: ITV) Lucy hasn't watched the Corrie storyline (Photo: ITV) It's important for young people to watch the storyline (Photo: ITV) 
“But it’s so important for it to be on, especially at this time, because we’re targeting young viewers watching before watershed. 
“It’s so important to target those people.” 
Lucy also spoke about an upcoming scene which sees Bethany surrounded by lots of older men, including Nathan, in the apartment. 
She explained how “uncomfortable it was to film”. Read More Lucy and Chris Harper were on Lorraine (Photo: ITV) Lucy spoke about filming the uncomfortable scenes (Photo: ITV) 
An upcoming Corrie spoiler clip was also shown on Lorraine, in which Nathan’s friend Mel - who is also involved in the grooming ring - is sat talking to her. 
In the short video, she’s seen talking to Bethany about making sure she’s not getting pregnant from sex with Nathan. 
She then tells her about the implant and Bethany says: “It’s much easier than the pill, isn’t it?” The pair urged young viewers to watch (Photo: ITV) But they both find it uncomfortable to film (Photo: ITV) 
Is Bethany in even more danger?
